linear_guide: Say hello to the AI assistant and ask for help (see instructions on the left).
Try to get an appointment as soon as possible (right now it is `StartTimeHour@schedule` on `Day@schedule`).
Keep asking for other times until the assistant has found a slot for you. Engage in smalltalk once this is done.
Say something about `DoctorName@schedule`, the AI Assistant, or something that has happened to you today. Be creative!
It occurs to you that you also want to make an appointment to get your kid `PersonName-2@schedule` vaccinated. Perhaps you can schedule a second appointment at the same time?
Keep going until both yours and your kid's appointments are made (this should take a few more turns). Then say goodbye.
task_descriptions: You are `PersonName-1@schedule` and would like to make an appointment with `DoctorName@schedule` for today (`Day@schedule`). You have had a `Symptoms@schedule` for two days now.

Wizard.task_description:
Follow the flow charts and help the user. Some facts you should be aware of: 

* Right now it is `Day@schedule`, `StartTimeHour@schedule`
